Reason: The configuration option 'compaction_large_partition_warning_threshold_mb' is performance-sensitive. The code context provided shows that this configuration is used to determine when to log a warning for writing large partitions to an SSTable. The 'rowSize > DatabaseDescriptor.getCompactionLargePartitionWarningThreshold()' condition directly impacts the performance of the system by triggering a warning message when a large partition is encountered during compaction. This operation is time-expensive as it involves checking the size of the row against the threshold set in the configuration. Therefore, this configuration directly affects system performance at the system level by introducing additional processing overhead when handling large partitions, making it performance-sensitive.
